Certainly! Some of the paintings of John Constable that showcase his use of light and color to the greatest extent are:

1. The Hay Wain (1821) - the most famous painting of Constable that portrays his skill in depicting natural light and color
2. Salisbury Cathedral from the Meadows (1831) - a stunning landscape painting that portrays different weather conditions and lighting effects
3. Cloud Study, 1822 - a beautiful study of the sky that captures the ever-changing light and color of nature
4. The White Horse (1819) - a vibrant painting that portrays the dramatic sky and the effect of light on the landscape
5. Dedham Vale (1802-4) - a beautiful view of the Dedham Vale that portrays the play of light and shadow in the landscape
6. Hadleigh Castle (1829) - a beautiful depiction of the ruins of Hadleigh Castle that showcases the dramatic effect of light on the landscape.
